snippet: Secretary of State John Kerry, who has never publicly offered his personal views on the Keystone XL oil pipeline, now must make a recommendation on the international project to President Obama.
abstract: State Department releases report concluding that the Keystone XL pipeline would not substantially worsen carbon pollution; findings leave an opening for Pres Obama to approve the politically divisive project, frustrating environmentalists; report sets up difficult decision for Sec of State John Kerry, who will have to make recommendation to Pres Obama, and who hopes to make action on climate change a key part of his legacy.
lead_paragraph: Secretary of State John Kerry, who has never publicly offered his personal views on the Keystone XL oil pipeline, now must make a recommendation on the international project to President Obama.

headline.main: Report Opens Way to Approval for Keystone Pipeline
headline.print_headline: Federal Report Removes Hurdle for Oil Pipeline
